content.description: Bomber hand crack through a bulge, then move left into an upper chimney. Same finish as Farewell Angelina. Walk-off descent climber's right from gear anchor.
content.protection: Standard rack, bring a large cam or two for anchor (gear anchor).
content.location: 20 feet right of Farewell Angelina, just behind and left of a large tree snag.

content.description: Fun, typical Old Rag: undercling crack system to a crimpy crux (tricky feet) on a face, ending in a hand crack and upper chimney. Walk-off descent climber's right from gear anchor. Photos show significant lichen at Snag Wall, but as of 2018 the lichen was not on the route itself.
content.protection: 1 bolt at the crux. Standard rack plus a large cam or two for a gear anchor (no fixed anchor). Walk-off descent.
content.location: Left of the large tree snag, look for the bolt protecting the crux.

content.description: Out-of-the-way but worthwhile Old Rag crag named for the large obvious snag against the wall. Room for more routes.
